author: akyar.ozgur
title: Grow Turkey Grow Cardano
description: How can we grow the Cardano ecosystem in Turkey?

f6_assessments.q0:
Disclaimer: my view points are shaped by my multi-year experience in product management and software development.

The objective of the challenge to grow the adoption of Cardano in Turkey is inline with the strategic objectives of Fund 8, such as to grow the number of contributors and to grow the dev and app ecosystem.

At the same time the budget requested for the proposal is high when looked from the per capita angle: $200k for 80M population in comparison with those for LatAm ($500k, 660 million) and India ($150k, 1400 million).

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of a discusion about the ability to achieve a noticeable impact.
- 1 point for the lack of a discussion about ROI in comparison with alternative initiaitves.
My rating is 3.
f6_assessments.q1:
Given a challenge team of three members, and the experience of Catalyst community with similar challenges focused on the growth in specific regions, the Catalyst community seems to be well positioned to address the challenge.

he proposal could be stronger if included:
1) an overview of high-ROI regional growth success stories to provide insights into potential impact from the requested funds.
2) an analysis of high-potential growth use cases.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of specific use cases.
- 1 point for the lack of a discussion about the sufficiency of the requested funds to achieve a noticeable impact.
My rating is 3.
f6_assessments.q2:
The defined metrics (the number of stake pools, the number of developers, the number of proposals, etc.) can be user to track the progress towards the objective of the challenge.

At the same time, the proposal would be stronger if it considered metrics / ideas highlighting the impact of the challenge on the Cardano ecosystem and the incremental contribution of the projects in this challenge:
1) % of stakepools operated from Turkey.
2) % of Cardano apps developed by developers from Turkey.
3) % of highly-rated Catalyst proposals made by proposers from Turkey.
4) the number of developers, stakepools, proposals added as a direct result of this initiaitve.
5) the cost of onboarding a new user, developer, stake-pool operator, proposer.
6) the satisfaction of users/developers onboarded through this initiative in comparison with alternative channels.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating the relative impact on the Cardano ecosystem.
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating user satisfaction and the competitiveness of the solutions.
My rating is 3.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposers do a good job in explaining the potential of Turkey as a place to grow Cardano but i don't believe it's fair or productive to set a challenge for just 1 country. It would make more sense and have more impact to focus on regions that Turkey is part of such as Western Asia or Southeast Europe. My assessment might seem unfair given that Japan got it's own challenge in fund7, but my score would have been the same for the challenge proposal. Effectively i disagree because i believe regional focused challenges have more impact then country focused ones
f6_assessments.q1: I'm not familiar with the Turkish Cardano community, but given that there is already a team (of 3 members) formed for this challenge and the high number of cryptocurrency users in the country i have no doubt the community will be able to address this challenge effectively.
f6_assessments.q2: A number of relevant and measurable metrics are proposed. The "Increased awareness about the Cardano blockchain in Turkish speaking communities" metric will be hard to measure, suggest a more measurable metric such number of posts/publications in relevant Turkish community forums.

f6_assessments.q0: I can agree that this challenge effectively addresses the Fund8 strategic goals. As stated in the challenge, the turkish community could become big drive to the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The plan of this proposal is very clear written and detailed, the challenge team intends to build an online and in-person community in Turkey.
The size of the challenge team and representation of individual members are included.
My suggestion is to concentrate on development of Turkish community hubs with a broad program in education, workshops and meetups, as well as an active online presence.
One remark, under "What does success look like?", it is difficult to understand, this sentence needs edit. I think there is also an error, instead of year 2022 it is written for 2023.
f6_assessments.q2:
The metrics for the success of this proposal are clearly defined.
I strongly agree that this challenge provides complete and comprehensible information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: I am not 100% convinced that turkey is the key-market for cardano adoption, especially as turkey is facing legal actions against blockchain techology (starting with Bitcoin)
f6_assessments.q1: I dont think the global community can properly adress and analyse a local market.
f6_assessments.q2: as it is only a proposal for beeing added into the next fund I dont expect detailed success criteria. but if you could add at least some measurably qualities to the succc-criteria it would help.

f6_assessments.q0: This challenge brings Turkish contributors and developers to the Cardano ecosystem which matches Cardano's mission goals in Fund 8 and two strategic goals.
f6_assessments.q1: The Cardano community in Turkey defined in the challenge is relatively small based upon the budget request however out of the total budget the request is moderate.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria and key metrics are reasonably defined.

f6_assessments.q0: I strongly agree this challenge is critical to achieve Cardano's mission since it creates a place for Turkish people to make contribution to the ecosystem. The current situation of cryptocurrency in Turkey having now 2.4 millions users, but the reality is very few of them knowing ADA/ Cardano - is a chance for Cardano grows and pushes boundaries.
f6_assessments.q1: I think the Catalyst community absolutely has the capacity to address the challenge since it can handle such bigger challenge the Latin-America/ Africa. There is a group of 2853 Turkish people trading ADA on Telegram as well, and I suggest the proposer add the link of that group to reference part.
f6_assessments.q2:
I think the key metrics to measure success are correctly and thoughtfully set up with 2 types them: the public measurement (after voting) and the growth of Turkish community presented in each proposal. 
I just want to advice team to rephrase this key metric: "A number of accounts under on proposal under this challenge" for clearer words. For example: A number of accounts on Ideascale/ people has been in-charged in proposals of this challenge.

importance: Decentralisation and resilience of Cardano is based on the inclusion of different locations including those communities not involved.
success: Motivated community of developers, SPOs, stakers, voters, challange teams collaborating for the growth of Cardano from Turkey in 2023.
